message: This is the first round. The product is of unknown quality. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. If you're not interested, I'll move on to the next one.
I'd like to buy the product, but only if it's high quality.

I've got a great one for you this time! I've sold you a high-quality product in the previous round, and now I've got another one that's just as good. You know the value of a high-quality product is $2000000 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, which is a 50% discount. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I'll have another high-quality product available in the next round.
I'll take the product, but I'm only willing to pay $500000, not $1000000.

You got a great deal on the last one, didn't you? I'm glad you're interested in another high-quality product. However, I'm not willing to sell it to you for $500000. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $900000, which is still a significant discount from its true value of $2000000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I'll have another high-quality product available in the next round.
I'll take the product for $900000.

You're on a roll! Two high-quality products in a row. I'll be honest with you, I'm starting to think I might have a problem with low-quality products. I'm willing to sell this one to you for $800000. I'm trying to get rid of this one as quickly as possible, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the value you'll get from it.

I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a low price. I'll pass.

No worries, I understand. You're a savvy buyer. I've got a high-quality product for you this time, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $500000. I'm trying to make up for the low-quality product from last round, and I think this one is a great opportunity for you to get a good deal.

I'll take the product for $300000.

I think I've been too generous lately. This one's not worth much to you, and I'm not going to give it to you for free. I'll sell it to you for $100000, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. Take it or leave it.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at such a low price. I'll pass.
